image.altText: a close up shot of a man's face staring to the distance. He has short mousy brown hair and a short beard.

props.synopsis: Former NT Police constable Zachary Rolfe has been forced to answer questions about the night Kumanjayi Walker was killed. He previously objected to answering "each and every question" about the evening arguing his responses could "tend to incriminate him".

title.children: NT coroner forces Rolfe to answer questions about night Kumanjayi Walker died

image.altText: A sale sign outside a major retail outlet.

props.synopsis: Consumer prices rose 3.4 per cent over the year to January, steady at the same annual rate of inflation as in December.

title.children: Inflation steady in January, below economist expectations of a bounce

image.altText: A man pointing at a bushfire

props.synopsis: Fire authorities are warning of extreme fire danger risk in Victoria's west and South Australia, as an out-of-control bushfire that began last week continues to burn.

title.children: Victorian residents fear the worst with bushfire conditions expected to worsen

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Next few hours crucial to see how Victorian weather conditions develop, authorities say
Beaufort residents prepare for the worst
Bayindeen fire contained but fire crews remain on alert

image.altText: Sydney couple luke davies and jesse baird were allegedly murdered on Monday February 19

props.synopsis: 2024's Mardi Gras will be remembered as the year of pain. Not for the first time, the spectre of violence hangs over the parade. This time it allegedly comes from a police officer and one of the community's own, writes Jason Om.

title.children: Justice must be served for Luke Davies and Jesse Baird. How NSW Police achieve it will be heavily scrutinised

image.altText: Police officers stand by police tape

props.synopsis: Police say the victim was shot in the groin on the ninth floor of an office building in Sydney's CBD this afternoon.

title.children: Law firm workers restrain alleged gunman after man shot on ninth floor of office in Sydney CBD

image.altText: Two men in inflatable pig suits indoors, holding troughs of fake money

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says the government won't do a deal with the Greens to pass its help-to-buy scheme, which the minor party says will worsen the housing crisis. Follow live.

title.children: Katter and Wilkie dress as pigs in parliament, PM says no deal (again) to Greens on housing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We watched it so you didn't have to: Key takeaways from Question Time
Immigration minister targeted as Question Time kicks off
Ukrainian ambassador calls for more support from Australia

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab and a man make a love heart with their hands.

props.synopsis: Maryam Sayed Deeb and Abdullah Abu Nahl got married during the Israel-Gaza war, but two days later they were killed in an Israeli air strike.

title.children: 'She did not have time to be happy': Maryam was killed days after marrying the love of her life

image.altText: An old black and white group photo with a man in glasses and a woollen jumper spotlighted in red.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Education Department sent unqualified teachers into classrooms in the 1960s and then failed to sack them following reports they were sexually abusing their students, according to recently discovered documents.

title.children: 'An educated man who preyed on his students': Woman sues Victorian government over alleged abuse by high school teacher

image.altText: A picture of two men is cropped into a bigger image of the front of a home with dozens of flowers laid out the front.

props.synopsis: NSW Police will continue investigating a property in Bungonia overnight where two bodies were found as a vigil is held for Sydney couple Jesse Baird and Luke Davies.

title.children: Tributes shared for Jesse Baird and Luke Davies as police continue investigating property where two bodies were found

image.altText: Grain silo in paddock

props.synopsis: Emergency services cut through the collapsed bottom of a silo at a rural Queensland property to help the trapped man who was "drowning" in grain.

title.children: Rescuers free man 'drowning' in grain underneath collapsed silo

image.altText: Band members wearing all black with faces covered by masks.

props.synopsis: Hitler salutes, white supremacy slogans and symbols of hate … insiders say Nazi bands have become an open secret within Australia's metal scene, as fans prepare for the return of major international event Knotfest next month.

title.children: 'You've booked a Nazi band': The dark side of Aussie metal

image.altText: A white man in a blue collared shirt, surrounded by reporters and cameras. A sign behind him says 'Local Court'.

props.synopsis: Outback Wrangler star Matt Wright has indicated he will fight charges laid by the Northern Territory's work safety watchdog over a fatal helicopter crash that killed his co-star Chris "Willow" Wilson.

title.children: Matt Wright and company Helibrook to contest NT WorkSafe charges over chopper crash

image.altText: a screen shows a calculator that can assist people to understand how tax cuts will affect them.

props.synopsis: Want to know how much you'll benefit from tax cuts coming in July? Use our tax cut calculator to find out.

title.children: Stage 3 tax cuts calculator: See how the new cuts will affect you

image.altText: A close up of police tape in an outdoor setting, with a white car in the background.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy was also found with serious injuries at the property where the vehicle was located. The alleged driver, 44, is facing multiple charges.

title.children: Girl, 15, found dead after ute allegedly driven from scene of crash in NSW

image.altText: A text message reading: 'Medicare: Due to the recent abnormal operation of your Medicare, we have to suspend your service.'

props.synopsis: Australian authorities say the newest scam threatens to suspend or freeze Medicare accounts.

title.children: Authorities say 'spike' in Medicare scam text messages

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair sits at a computer desk, it is covered with stationary.

props.synopsis: It's official, men are paid more than women at many of the country's major companies, including banks, retailers, legal firms and mines, but what is being done to address it?

title.children: Workers reluctant to return to the office may intensify gender pay gap, lawyers warn

image.altText: Beachgoers seek shade under umbrellas.

props.synopsis: While weather forecasters tend to talk in terms of "overnight lows", Adelaide's temperature hovered in the mid-30s throughout the small hours ahead of more forecast hot conditions and an elevated bushfire risk.

title.children: South Australians awake to sweltering pre-dawn temperatures as bushfire risk climbs

image.altText: people walking outside a store

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading flat after a mixed session on Wall Street, while Optus and Sony are the latest companies to cut jobs, and Australia's annual inflation remains at its lowest level since November 2021. Follow live.

title.children: Inflation remains at two-year low, Optus and Sony announce hundreds of job cuts, ASX flat

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Could February 29 save the economy from a technical recession?
ASIC secures interim travel restraint orders against former Blockchain Global director
Qantas responds to $21K compensation payout for illegally sacked worker

image.altText: A close up of a woman with green eyes smiling while wearing a blue cap and top.

props.synopsis: Prominent social media influencers are being recruited in a new effort to combat pro-vaping messaging online, to try to convince young Australians to give up the nicotine habit.

title.children: Sporting stars, comedians recruited in anti-vape campaign as vaping rules change again

image.altText: A man wearing glasses with a tie.

props.synopsis: The confirmation comes after French President Emmanuel Macron earlier said sending troops should not be "ruled out".

title.children: NATO allies say they won't send troops to Ukraine, after reports of some Western countries considering it

image.altText: Run-DMC's Jason Mizell, known as Jam Master Jay, poses in 1986.

props.synopsis: Karl Jordan Jr and Ronald Washington are found guilty by a federal jury in Brooklyn, New York.

title.children: Two men convicted over 2002 murder of Run-DMC's Jam Master Jay

image.altText: Astronomical clock in Prague

props.synopsis: Without adding an extra day to February almost every four years, a lot more would happen to us than you might think. We break down the science, and history, behind this ancient phenomenon.

title.children: It's a leap year, so why do we have to add a bonus day to our calendar again?

image.altText: Coles and Woolworths branding outside neighbouring supermarkets

props.synopsis: Accusations of price gouging have again been levelled at Coles after the supermarket giant revealed another bumper profit.

title.children: 'No-one has to earn a 30pc profit rate': Coles accused of gouging shoppers as they struggle to put food on table

image.altText: Ken Rutherford and Allan Border talk

props.synopsis: Australia and New Zealand are the closest of sporting rivals. But when it comes to Test match cricket, tours between the two are all too often an afterthought.

title.children: It's annoyingly rare for Australia and NZ to play Test cricket against each other, and all boils down to one reason

image.altText: Male coworkers discussing in office, looking at documents. One man looks bored and exhausted

props.synopsis: Every noticed how some people are good at creating friction while others help smooth it over? Here's how leaders and employees can help build harmonious workplaces for everyone.

title.children: Why the 'cone of friction' should be avoided at all costs

image.altText: A woman holds a photo frame in an arm chair

props.synopsis: Alex's close friend died last year from alcohol-induced organ failure. She thinks tighter restrictions on quick drink delivery services which don't have any checks and balances could have helped slow his drinking.

title.children: Alex believes alcohol delivery services contributed to her friend's death at age 46

image.altText: A plane prepares to touch down at an airport runway.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians get ready to vote in a state election, experts are predicting a gloomy time ahead for the state, with a shrinking population and economic downturn expected.

title.children: Do you want to move to Tasmania? Probably not, and that's why the island state's dream run is over

image.altText: Musician singing into microphone on stage.

props.synopsis: From reclaiming pop culture references to surviving pirates on perilous journeys, a new generation of Asian Australian hip hop artists are drawing on their culture and backgrounds as inspiration for their lyrics and drive.

title.children: Asian Australian musicians explore themes of diaspora and culture through hip hop

image.altText: A composite of two girls smiling into the camera.

props.synopsis: Moving abroad can be a strange experience. From seeing Aussies wearing thongs virtually anywhere to Bunnings snags and lighting up the barbecue on every occasion. Nada and Solange explain what sets Australia apart.

title.children: 'Everyone is so friendly here': Here's what sets Australia apart according to two young migrants

image.altText: Graphic showing faces of five smiling teenage girls against green background covered with maths formulas.

props.synopsis: Maths anxiety usually starts in school but it can impact your career path, finances and confidence throughout life. The good news is most people can learn to love numbers.

title.children: Don't think you have a 'maths brain'? You might surprise yourself

image.altText: An army tank

props.synopsis: An Israeli company whose technology was stripped from Australian Army equipment over possible data security concerns three years ago has been awarded a fresh defence contract worth $917 million.

title.children: Controversial Israeli weapons company awarded $917 million Australian army contract

image.altText: Twisted metal transmission towers under a grey sky.

props.synopsis: The word "unprecedented" is losing impact as the world lurches from one crazy weather event to the next. The term "climate change" doesn't do enough to describe what is happening.

title.children: After a weird summer where floods gave way to heatwaves, scientists explain why we're seeing weather extremes 'on steroids'

image.altText: Chinese President Xi Jinping raises a glass of wine while standing in front of a Chinese flag

props.synopsis: Australia hopes China will soon drop tariffs on its wine, but the trade war continues to wreak havoc.

title.children: Trade war fallout continues as exporters hope for good news

image.altText: A TV still of Gordon Cormier, a Canadian Filipino teenager dressed as Avatar, poised for a fight. A man in a mask looms behind.

props.synopsis: The new live-action Avatar: The Last Airbender on Netflix keeps the premise of the animated original but fails to live up to its effortlessly astounding spectacle.

title.children: This is what happens when you shove Avatar: The Last Airbender into the Netflix machine
